title: Closing Tauri app orphans processes in system tray that can't be quit
description: When closing the Tauri desktop app, processes are left orphaned in the system tray. These orphaned processes cannot be quit or killed through normal means - requires opening system monitor to force kill them. The app shutdown/cleanup is not properly terminating all child processes.

title: Message list cannot scroll fully to bottom, last message cut off
description:
The message list cannot scroll far enough to show the most recent message fully. The bottom of the last message is clipped/hidden behind the message input bar and voice connection panel.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Join a voice channel (voice connected bar appears at bottom)
2. Send or receive messages with images/GIFs so the list needs scrolling
3. Try to scroll to the very bottom of the message list
4. The last message is cut off â€” only the top half is visible

**Expected:** The message list should be able to scroll completely to the bottom so the most recent message is fully visible above the message input.

**Likely cause:** The message list container height calculation doesn't account for all bottom elements (voice connected bar, user panel) stacking below the message input, so the Virtuoso scroll area is taller than the visible space allows.
close_reason: Added min-height: 0 to chat-area-wrapper, chat-area, and message-list to fix flex overflow causing last message cutoff

title: Embedded links (YouTube etc) not working
description: Links posted in chat (e.g. YouTube URLs) don't render as embeds/previews. Need link unfurling with metadata extraction and preview rendering.
close_reason: Added YouTube embed support in Markdown renderer (detects youtube.com/youtu.be URLs, renders iframe embeds)

title: Stop cloning entire Maps on every gateway event
description: Every set() call in the gateway handler clones all top-level Maps (messages, reactions, users, presences) with new Map(state.xxx). As Maps grow, cloning gets expensive. A PRESENCE_UPDATE firing every few seconds clones a users Map with thousands of entries. Fix: only clone the specific sub-map being modified, or adopt Immer for structural sharing.

title: Persist navigation state across page refresh
description: Refreshing the page loses current server/channel context. Need to persist active server and text channel so users return to where they were. Voice/video resume not needed. Could use URL routing or localStorage.

title: Push to talk support
description: Support push-to-talk as an alternative to voice activity detection. User should be able to configure a keybind for PTT in voice/audio settings. Related to drocsid-610 (voice & video settings panel).

title: Bluesky embeds fail: Invalid DID regex error
description: embed.bsky.app requires a DID (did:plc:xxx) in the URL path, not a handle. We were passing the raw handle from the bsky.app URL. Fix: resolve handle to DID via public.api.bsky.app before rendering the iframe.
close_reason: Fixed: BlueskyEmbed component now resolves handle->DID via public API before rendering iframe. Also fixed handle regex to support hyphens. DID results cached in-memory.

title: Account deletion with full cleanup
description: Allow users to delete their account, which should leave all servers, stop all notifications, and clean up associated data. Should have a confirmation flow to prevent accidental deletion.
close_reason: Implemented account deletion with migration for FK cascades, backend DELETE /@me endpoint with password verification, gateway disconnect, and frontend danger zone UI with password confirmation

title: Per-user volume control in voice channels
description: Allow users to adjust individual participant volumes while in a voice channel. Similar to Discord's per-user volume slider on right-click.

title: Cannot edit, rename, or delete channels
description: If you misname a channel there's no way to edit it. Need channel edit/rename functionality.

title: Scroll-to-bottom overlay when not at latest message
description: When the user has scrolled up in a chat channel and is not viewing the latest messages, show a small floating overlay/button (e.g. a down arrow) that jumps them back to the most recent message when clicked.

title: Channel not scrolled to bottom when first opened after login
description: After logging in (landing on no server), clicking a server and then a channel does not scroll to the most recent messages. The user sees older messages and has to refresh to get scrolled to the bottom. The scroll-to-bottom logic likely only runs on mount/message changes but not on initial channel switch when messages are first loaded.

title: GIF picker does not scroll selected GIF into view
description: When picking a GIF in the GIF picker, the GIF is sent and displayed in chat but the message list does not scroll it into view. The GIF appears off-screen below the visible area.
notes: Fix: removed initialScrollGrace gate from media load re-scroll handler. Now any image/embed load while at the bottom triggers a re-scroll. Also removed loading=lazy from embedded images since Virtuoso virtualizes off-screen items.

title: Make web app installable as PWA
description: Add a web app manifest and service worker so the web version can be installed as a Progressive Web App on desktop and mobile. This provides an app-like experience (home screen icon, standalone window) without requiring the Tauri desktop build.

title: Messages disappear when referenced user is deleted
description: When a user is deleted, messages.author_id is SET NULL (migration 0008). But the Rust Message struct has author_id: Uuid (non-optional), so SQLx fails to deserialize any row with NULL author_id, causing the ENTIRE get_messages query to fail and return no messages for the channel. Fix: make author_id Option<Uuid> and handle deleted-user display in frontend.

title: @mention autocomplete menu in message input
description: When typing @ in the message input, show an autocomplete dropdown of server members filtered as the user types. Allow selecting with arrow keys and completing with Tab or clicking. Similar to the existing slash command suggestion system but for user mentions.

title: Voice ghost users: not removed from channel on disconnect
description: When disconnecting from voice, users sometimes remain in the participant list for other users. Root causes: (1) No beforeunload handler to call voice leave API on tab close, (2) No server-side heartbeat timeout enforcement - dead clients stay connected until OS TCP keepalive fires (minutes), (3) voiceLeave swallows API errors silently with .catch(() => {}).
close_reason: Fixed: (1) Added server-side heartbeat timeout (2.5x interval) to detect dead clients, (2) Added beforeunload handler with sendBeacon to fire voice leave on tab close, (3) Auth extractor now accepts ?token= query param for sendBeacon compat

title: Research: Tauri desktop app migration

Needs thorough planning around: build pipeline, platform support, native features (system tray, notifications, auto-update), how existing web app coexists, and migration path. Important but not urgent â€” park for deeper discussion.
close_reason: Research complete: decided on bundled frontend + configurable backend approach, multi-instance support, Tauri v2

title: Custom banner images for servers/channels

Needs careful treatment to keep text/buttons readable â€” likely a dark overlay or blur layer between the image and the UI elements. description: Media devices (microphone, camera) are detected and selectable in the web browser but do not appear in the Tauri desktop build. Likely a missing permission or capability in the Tauri configuration for mediaDevices/getUserMedia access.

title: Keyboard shortcuts help not accessible in UI

title: Windows desktop: audio I/O broken, device names truncated
description: Audio input/output not working on Windows desktop app. Device names in settings are truncated compared to actual Windows device names. Drocsid shows short names like 'Stream Input', 'Microphone', 'Speakers' while Discord shows full names like 'Microphone (RODECaster Duo Chat)', 'Virtual Input (RÃ˜DE Connect)', 'Speakers (RODECaster Duo Chat)'. Root cause: non-Linux platform module in audio_io.rs uses cpal's deprecated device.name() which returns truncated WASAPI names. CI build logs confirm deprecation warning suggesting description() for comprehensive device info and id() for stable identifiers. See bug_images/ for screenshots comparing Drocsid vs Discord device lists.
close_reason: Switched non-Linux platform module from deprecated device.name() to device.description() for full display names and device.id() for stable unique identifiers. Uses device_by_id() for direct lookup instead of name-matching iteration.

title: Keyboard shortcuts help dialog
description: Add an info/help button (e.g. in the server sidebar or user panel) that opens a dialog listing all keyboard shortcuts: Ctrl+K (quick switcher), Ctrl+B (toggle members), Ctrl+\ (toggle channels), etc.

title: Store and cancel gateway reconnect timers

title: Fix heartbeat jitter setTimeout race condition
description: startHeartbeat() at gateway.ts:114 stores the setInterval but NOT the initial jitter setTimeout. If stopHeartbeat() is called during the jitter window, the interval still gets created afterward, leading to orphaned intervals. Fix: store the jitter timeout ID and cancel it in stopHeartbeat().

title: Avatar/icon not updating in UI after upload without refresh
description:
After uploading a user avatar or server icon, the image saves to the backend correctly but the UI doesn't reflect the change in all places until a full page refresh.

**User avatar:**
- Avatar updates in the settings panel after upload
- Does NOT update in: channel message history (messages still show old avatar), voice channel sidebar, or other places showing the user's avatar
- The uploader should see their new avatar everywhere immediately after upload, including on all their messages in the current channel

**Server icon:**
- Icon saves correctly (confirmed in server settings)
- Does NOT update in the sidebar server icon list until page refresh
- The server icon in the left sidebar doesn't fill the rounded button properly (sizing/object-fit issue)

**Expected behavior:**
- After uploading, the uploader should see the new avatar/icon reflected everywhere in the UI immediately (messages in channel, sidebar, voice, server list)
- Channel messages sent by the user should show the updated avatar right away without refresh
- Other users can see updates on refresh/reconnect (real-time propagation is a nice-to-have for later)

**Root cause (likely):**
- User avatar: After upload, only the auth store user object is updated. Components that render avatars from the users cache (serverStore.users map) still have the old avatar_url. Need to also update the cached user entry in serverStore.users so all message components re-render with the new avatar.
- Server icon: After upload, updateServer API is called but the local server object in the store may not be getting updated reactively, or the sidebar server list component isn't re-rendering from the updated store.
- Server icon sizing: The server icon img in the sidebar needs object-fit: cover and proper sizing to fill the rounded button.
close_reason: Synced avatar to serverStore.users cache, updated servers array after icon upload, added avatar images to messages and voice panel, fixed CSS

title: Voice audio not reaching other users; extra unused 'Drocsid' sink created

Two issues after PipeWire micâ†’sink routing migration:

title: Fix LiveKit voice/video - container crash loop
description:
LiveKit container panics on startup with 'invalid argument to Intn' in getNAT1to1IPsForConf when use_external_ip is true. STUN auto-detection fails even with explicit stun servers and host networking. The container is in a crash loop on lighthouse (192.168.50.10).

Setup: Docker with network_mode: host, config file at docker/livekit.yaml, keys via LIVEKIT_KEYS env var. Signaling proxied through Cloudflare Tunnel via nginx /livekit/ location. Media ports (7881 TCP, 7882 UDP) port-forwarded on router.

Attempted fixes that didn't work:
1. Switched from Docker bridge to host networking
2. Added explicit STUN servers (stun.l.google.com:19302)
3. Set use_external_ip: false with --node-ip from env var (not fully tested)

Key files: docker/docker-compose.prod.yml, docker/livekit.yaml, deploy/nginx/drocsid.conf

The root issue is that STUN doesn't work from this network/server. Need to figure out why, or find a reliable alternative for providing the public IP to LiveKit ICE candidates.
close_reason: Fixed. Root cause was rand.Intn(0) panic when port_range_start == port_range_end (both 7882). Also removed broken --node-ip workaround and reverted to STUN-based IP discovery with host networking.

title: Re-introduce react-virtuoso for MessageList
description: MessageList currently renders every message as a real DOM node (messages.map over entire array). With loadMoreMessages prepending 50 more each time, 500+ DOM nodes accumulate â€” each with Markdown, avatars, reactions, hover handlers. Re-add react-virtuoso for windowed rendering (~20 visible DOM nodes instead of 500). The original removal was a misdiagnosis â€” the scroll-to-bottom bug was a race condition with async media, not virtuoso. Map current scroll logic to virtuoso API: followOutput (auto-scroll), startReached (infinite scroll), initialTopMostItemIndex (start at bottom), atBottomStateChange (position tracking). Keep the capture-phase load listener for async media re-scrolling.

title: Web client cannot see desktop user's speaking indicator in shared voice channel

The web client relies on LiveKit's ActiveSpeakersChanged room event, which may not be firing for the desktop user's published audio track.

title: Chat not scrolled to latest message on page load
Linux client missing input sink for mic routing; audio sources need distinct PipeWire names
description:
Two issues with Linux audio handling:

1. **No input sink for microphone**: The client doesn't create an input sink, so there's no way to route a microphone to it via PipeWire/pavucontrol.

2. **Indistinguishable audio source names**: Output audio sources have very similar or identical names in PipeWire, making it hard to tell them apart. They should be named distinctly, e.g.:
   - 'Drocsid App Sound Out' (application audio output)
   - 'Drocsid Voice Sound Out' (voice chat output)
   - 'Drocsid Voice Sound In' (microphone input)

title: Ability to close DMs while preserving conversation history
Code blocks (triple backtick) not rendering content
description:
When typing a triple-backtick code block in a message, the content between the backticks doesn't render â€” it appears blank/empty. Single backtick inline code works fine.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Type a message with triple backticks: ```some code```
2. Send the message
3. The code block area appears but the content inside is invisible/missing

**Expected:** Content between triple backticks should render in a code block.

**Possibly related:** The Markdown tokenizer regex for code blocks is ```(\w*)\n?([\s\S]*?)``` â€” it requires either a newline or content immediately after the opening backticks. If the user types the opening/closing backticks on the same line without a newline (e.g. ```test```), the (\w*) capture group may consume 'test' as the language identifier, leaving nothing for the content capture group. Need to investigate the tokenizer behavior for single-line code blocks vs multi-line.
close_reason: Fixed code block regex: split into multi-line (with language) and single-line (without) patterns so content is always captured
